title.value: Сравнительная оценка продуктивности ароматических сортов хмеля
Comparative estimation of yielding capacity of hop aromatic varieties
Comparative estimation of yielding capacity of hop aromatic varieties

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Regilevich, A.A., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in the Maloritsky district of Brest region on sod-podzolic sandy loam soil there was defined the efficiency of common hop (Humulus lupulus) aromatic varieties of German (Spalter Select and Perle), English (Northern Brewer) and Ukrainian (National) selection. In course of the study there was analysed yielding capacity of hop cones of hop aromatic varieties; content of alpha-acids in the studied cones; yielding capacity of alpha-acids per arable area unit. It is established that varieties of German selection from group aromatic, possess to higher potentials of efficiency on productivity, and the content of alpha acids that speaks about their production importance. The maximum productivity of cones of hop (14,4 c/ha) from group of studied aromatic grades was received at a grade of German selection of Perle. Cones of this grade were characterized by the maximum content of alpha acids - 8,4%, provided their greatest collecting from unit of area (1,24 c/ha).
